New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his first postseason home run in MLB history
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani's 372-foot (113-meter) three-run home run in the second inning
Dodgers comeback in the fourth and fifth innings
Will Smith scored on a wild pitch
Blake Treinen struck out Manny Machado to secure the win
Pre-Game Insights: Shohei Ohtani had never played an MLB postseason game before this
Post-Match Reflections: Shohei Ohtani expressed his enjoyment of the game and pride in contributing to the win
Dodgers players and manager highlighted the team's resilience and Ohtani's impact
Miscellaneous Highlights: Yu Darvish and Jack Flaherty set to pitch
